alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 4:34AM MST until March 16 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...the Verde River, from Camp Verde to the confluence with the East Verde River. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Further rises in the water levels of already flooded creeks and normally dry washes. Deadly flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 430 AM MST, gauge reports indicated that the Verde River near Camp Verde was at 11.4 feet and rising due to heavy rain and snowmelt. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Verde River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camp Verde and Middle Verde. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
